input_text:
Job Title: Event Coordinator, Transportation Partner Experience

Location: Seattle, WA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations

Description:
Description

The Transportation Partner Experience Events team is seeking an Event Coordinator to play a foundational role across our suite of global events. Your responsibility as an event coordinator will include managing event contract and financial approvals, leading event customer service and communications, supporting our event technology team with event website building & testing, and supporting critical Tier 1 event workstreams like F&B, Swag or staffing and supporting on site at events as needed.

The ideal candidate has foundational experience in event management is a communicator, is detail oriented and has project management/organizational skills. This person will be able to effectively work within a small team, while rolling up their sleeves and getting stuff done – no detail will be too small and they'll never say "that's not my job". They’ll obsess over details, display poise and sophistication in fast-moving situations, embrace ambiguity, and deliver results.

If this sounds like an exciting challenge, then we’d like to hear from you.

Role can be based out of Seattle or Nashville.

Key job responsibilities

 Create and manage all event inboxes and act as customer support lead for event related needs Contract/Approval routing management Creating Purchase Orders & reconciling financials Manage and organize swag globally Create and manage event team central resources Lead all event coordination with for in office streaming across applicable Tier 1 events. Coordinate and manage team offsite events Manage/captain executive handling at all TPX events creating detailed schedules, calendar holds, communication as needed. Tier 2 event website lead helping to manage creation, design and testing. Post event survey creation & testing Up to 25% travel required

About The Team

Have you seen the any of the Amazon trucks or delivery vehicles driving on the highways or around your neighborhood? Did you know those drivers actually work for small business owners that partner with Amazon to deliver packages?

The Transportation Partner Experience team builds innovative and engaging community-focused products for external Amazon partners like Freight Partners and Delivery Service Partner (DSPs). Small businesses are critical to many aspects of Amazon’s ecosystem and the AGC team helps these partners be successful by fostering community connections, accelerating learning opportunities, and providing customer feedback mechanisms on program and product initiatives and updates.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Nashville, TN, USA | Seattle, WA, USA

Basic Qualifications

 3+ years of professional non-internship marketing experience Knowledge of analytic tools Event coordination or management experience

Preferred Qualifications

 Experience in professional non-internship marketing

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $48,300/year in our lowest geographic market up to $116,300/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.



Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2605760

Experience Level (if available): None
